original: Carlander, Bertil Christoffer Hilde-brand, försäljningschef, Göteborg, f. 27/6/00 i Gbg av grosshandl Axel C. o. Hedvig Hildebrand. G. 35 m. Lis Hellesen. Barn: Anne f. 37, Axel 38, Vibeke 40, Lisbeth 43. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 18, fackkurs v. Gbgs hand:inst. Anst. v. SKF 20, tjg. på Balkan, i 0st- Europa, USA, Canada o. Belg. 21-31, i USA 34-35, försäljnxhef i Gbg sed. 32. V. ordf. i Gamlestadens Fabr. A-B, stynled. i KAK v. avd., i Fören. f. Gbgs försv. (led. av arb :utsk.), Röhsska konstslöjdsmüs. vänner o. i Femte majfonden, v. ordf. i styr. f. Carlanderska ’sjukhemm., kaissaförv. i Tekn. samf., rev. f. inst. f. OTtnamnis-o. dialektforskn. v. Gbgs’ högsk. Medl. av KAK, Biac’hielioir’s ciluib m. m. RDDO, BKrO, Dansk FrM.
translated: Carlander, Bertil Christoffer Hildebrand, sales manager, Gothenburg, born on June 27th, 1900 in Gothenburg to wholesale merchant Axel C. and Hedvig Hildebrand. Married in 1935 to Lis Hellesen. Children: Anne born in 1937, Axel in 1938, Vibeke in 1940, and Lisbeth in 1943. He finished his high school studies in Gothenburg in 1918 and completed specialized courses at the Gothenburg School of Business. He was employed by SKF in 1920 and worked in the Balkans, Eastern Europe, the USA, Canada, and Belgium from 1921-1931, and in the USA from 1934-1935. He has been sales manager in Gothenburg since 1932. He is the vice-chairman of Gamlestadens Fabr. A-B, a board member of the KAK department, a member of the Association for Gothenburg's Defense (a board member of the working committee), the Röhsska Art Crafts Museum's friends, and the Fifth of May Fund. He is the vice-chairman of the board of Carlanderska Hospital, treasurer of the Technical Society, reviewer of the institution for Onomastics and Dialect Research at Gothenburg University, and a member of KAK, Biachielioir's Ciluib, and more. He was awarded the RDDO, BKrO, and the Danish FrM.

memberOf.name: Institution for Onomastics and Dialect Research at Gothenburg University
